page.title: 14Homing Pigeons cont.
page.content: The fastest time recorded for flying this race is under 10 hrs. ( an average speed of 52 mph ). As all the birds in the races are released at one fixed point and have different distances to fly to reach their home 'loft' their speed is calculated in feet/min. All loft positions are measured on the National Grid System and recorded on computer to within a tolerance of 1 yard. Thus each bird's average speed can be checked very accurately. Racing pigeons are now bred specially for sport and prices vary enormously. Prize birds have been sold for as much as Â£10,000. One of the largest races for the North of England is the 'Vaux Gold Cup' which starts at Oudenaarde in Belgium, a distance of 270 miles and involving 50,000 birds.
